intro: Sterculia stipulifera subsp. peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian sterculia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to the Andean regions of South America, this plant thrives in humid, tropical climates. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local communities.
